title: Arsenal keeping Arsene Wenger is more important than Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez extensions, says Robert Pires
text:
'I BELIEVE IN ARSENE' Arsenal keeping Arsene Wenger is more important than Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez extensions, says Robert Pires 
Gunners legend believes it is vital that Frenchman remains in charge at the Emirates despite pressure By Gary Stonehouse Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ARSENE WENGER signing a new contract is more important for Arsenal than Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil extending their deals, according to Gunners legend Robert Pires. 
The Frenchman played under the 67-year-old during the peak years of Wenger’s reign. News Group Newspapers Ltd 5 Robert Pires says Arsenal keeping Arsene Wenger is the important thing the club need to do 
He was part of the Invincibles side that won the Premier League without being beaten, but the Gooners have not tasted title glory since. 
Keep up to date with ALL the ARSENAL gossip and transfers on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Pressure is growing on Wenger from the club’s fans, while star men Sanchez and Ozil are refusing to sign a new deal unless they receive a significant pay rise to make them the biggest earners in the north London side’s history. 
But for Pires, the most vital thing for his former club to do is tie the boss down to a new deal. 
Pires said: “I hope for him (Sanchez) and Ozil they extend with new contracts. The negotiation is very difficult and maybe complicated. “But the most important is to see Arsene Wenger extend. Arsene Wenger is very, very important for Arsenal for now and for next season. 
“I believe in Arsene Wenger. For me it was a privilege to work with him for six seasons. He was not perfect but he was good, we won some titles.” 
And he is not the first of his former team-mates to call on Wenger to stay at the Emirates. Getty Images The Arsenal legend Robert Pires believes Arsene Wenger staying is more important than keeping hold of Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez Getty Images Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil have still not agreed a contract extension with their existing deals expiring next year Getty Images Arsene Wenger has yet to announce whether he will sign a new deal and stay at Arsenal after this season News Group Newspapers Ltd 5 Former Arsenal goalkeeper Jens Lehman has been vocal in his support of Arsene Wenger 
Ex-goalkeeper Jens Lehman told talkSPORT : “It’s very difficult to replace intelligence, and we all know he is a very intelligent man and he’s still got the fire. 
“With all he’s done for the club, I think he deserves not to go on such a bad spell of results.” Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger is still undecided about his future Arsene Wenger protest goes ahead as two banners fly over the Hawthorns
